articles.author: Adam Tarcali
articles.description:
Whenever I get a new machine, reinstall my system, or start at a new workplace with a freshly installed IntelliJ IDEA, there are a few key settings I always configure right away. They save time, reduce friction, and help me stay focused on writing code instead of fighting the IDE.
Auto Import on the Fly


In the past, I used to lose precious minutes manually importing every missing package â€” especially when pasting code snippets from colleagues or external sources. Enabling â€œAuto-import on the flyâ€ ensures that IntelliJ automatically takes care of import statements as I write code.

It might seem like a small thing, but over the course of a day (or sprint), it adds up to a lot of saved time and fewer frustrating interruptions.
ğŸ‘‰ Settings â†’ Editor â†’ General â†’ Auto Import â†’Optimize imports â€¦
articles.title: The IntelliJ Settings I Always Change (Every. Single. Time.)

articles.author: Daniel R
articles.description:
Today was a massive win for Story Hero â€” we officially launched our first landing page at https://storyhero.site! ğŸš€
We built and shipped the landing page in record time using React inside Bolt.new, took inspiration from 21st.dev, and deployed via Netlify. Then we claimed our free custom domain using Entri (IONOS) â€” and just like that, Story Hero was live.
Itâ€™s:
ğŸ”„ Responsive & mobile-friendly
ğŸ’« Full of subtle animations
ğŸ” SEO-optimized with OG metadata
ğŸ“¬ Equipped with an email waitlist signup
Honestly, it turned out beautiful and exceeded our expectations â€” and itâ€™s already helping us tell the Story Hero story to the world.

We also whipped up our first draft of App Store screenshots. Theyâ€™re rough, but theyâ€™re enough to help us push towards our next big milestone: getting the app submitted for App Store review ASAP.

The review process can take time (and surprises happen), so our focus is to get a "good enough" build live fast, then iterate from there. The sooner we get it into Appleâ€™s hands, the sooner we can get real users and even paying subscribers â€” all before the hackathon ends.
This weekâ€™s progress gets us one step closer to the goal: launching a real product with paying users in just 30 days. Weâ€™re still going for the â€œMake More Moneyâ€ challenge, and every decision is focused on that north star.
Even if we donâ€™t win a prize, building Story Hero alongside this community is already worth it. Letâ€™s keep shipping.
â€“ Josh & Daniel

Team Story Hero
Story Hero
What is Story Hero?
Twitter/X
DEV Blog
articles.title: Story Hero - Day 12 Update

articles.author: Amit Salvi
articles.description:
1. Introduction


In this post, we'll create a minimal Java microservice using Spring Boot and Maven. We'll use Maven's archetype to bootstrap our project and add a simple REST endpoint using the embedded Tomcat server that comes with Spring Boot.
You can use Spring Boot's official archetype or simply use the spring-boot-starter-parent and manually add dependencies.
Option 1: Use Maven Archetype (Manually Add Dependencies)
mvn archetype:generate \


Then, modify the pom.xml to convert it into a Spring Boot project
Replace the contents of pom.xml with:
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0
         http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
  <modelVeâ€¦
articles.title: Create a Java Microservice Using Spring Boot in Minutes with Maven

articles.author: Aayush Jain
articles.description:
The Opensearch folks who extended Elasticsearch are not stupid â€“ that's why determining how one stores data in an OS Cluster is an index-level configurable setting, not one flat setting to apply throughout. 
Which puts the onus on us â€“ to determine the most efficient, cheapest and fastest way to store data â€“ for every different index. 
If you have enough unused-compute in your OS Nodes, below are perhaps the best compression algorithms to use for your usecases when you know the read and write patterns to your index.

Let's look at the why:
Frequent Writes, Frequent Reads: zstd_no_dict
Reasoning: This codec offers the best write performance and very good read performance. Since both reads and writes are frequent, prioritizing speed is crucial. While compression is slightly less than zstd, tâ€¦
articles.title: Compressing for Performance over Cost in Opensearch

articles.author: Babs
articles.description:
A while ago, I had the opportunity to lead a practical session with a few of my students, where we explored the power and flexibility of Wazuhâ€”a free, open-source security platform offering extended detection and response (XDR) and SIEM capabilities.
The goal of the session was to help them understand how Wazuh can be used to monitor system integrity, detect malware, and centralize security operations. Here's a detailed breakdown of what we covered during the lab:
We started with deploying Wazuh and installing its agent on both Kali Linux and Windows OS systems in our lab environment. The students learned how to ensure the agent is properly connected and visible within the Wazuh dashboard.
One of the key things I emphasized was the importance of SSH access to the Wazuh server. Since the Waâ€¦
articles.title: Exploring Wazuh SIEM Capabilities in a Hands-On Lab Session

articles.author: Moya Richards
articles.description:
Have you ever found yourself scratching your head when your AWS Lambda function works perfectly in one region but fails in another? 
Recently, I encountered this exact scenario when moving a function from us-east-1 to eu-west-1. 
The culprit? VPC endpoints and Secrets Manager access. 
Let's dive into the problem and its solution.
Our Lambda function, happily running in us-east-1, suddenly threw this error when deployed to eu-west-1:
An error occurred (AccessDeniedException) when calling the GetSecretValue operation: User: arn:aws:sts::ACCOUNT_ID:assumed-role/ROLE_NAME is not authorized to perform: secretsmanager:GetSecretValue on resource: SECRET_ARN because no identity-based policy allows the secretsmanager:GetSecretValue action

The puzzling part? The IAM permissions were identical in boâ€¦
articles.title: Resolving AWS Secrets Manager Access in AWS Lambda: A Tale of Two Regions

articles.author: Dalton A. Breshears, J.D.
articles.description:
Artificial Intelligence (AI) is increasingly impacting nearly every corner of the legal world, and Family Law is no exception. While deeply personal and emotionally charged matters like divorce and child custody may seem immune to automation, AI is proving to be a powerful toolâ€”not in replacing human judgment, but in improving efficiency, objectivity, and access to justice.
Hereâ€™s how AI is reshaping the family law landscape:
Smarter Document Generation & Case Preparation
AI-powered platforms are now being used by family law attorneys to draft divorce petitions, custody agreements, and financial disclosures more efficiently. These tools can generate personalized templates based on client input, reducing the time and cost of preparing essential legal documents.
Instead of starting from scraâ€¦
articles.title: How AI Is Affecting the Family Law Industry: A New Chapter for Child Custody and Divorce Cases

articles.author: Dalton A. Breshears, J.D.
articles.description:
AI is beginning to reshape the estate planning field, streamlining routine processes and shifting how attorneys deliver value to clients. While the human element remains central to this deeply personal area of law, AI is enhancing how attorneys operateâ€”both behind the scenes and at the client-facing level.
Key Ways AI Is Impacting Estate Planning Attorneys:
Client Intake and Communication Some firms are using AI chatbots or guided questionnaires to collect initial client information, identify goals, and flag common issues. This reduces administrative work and helps attorneys begin each case with clearer context.
Risk Detection and Compliance AI tools can now analyze estate documents for errors, inconsistencies, or missing provisions. This adds a layer of quality control and helps attorneys ensure documents align with a clientâ€™s objectives and current laws.
Educational Tools and Client Empowerment AI-driven platforms can also help clients understand complex concepts like probate, trust funding, or tax exposureâ€”making the attorneyâ€™s job easier and consultations more productive.
AI isnâ€™t replacing estate planning attorneysâ€”itâ€™s refining their role. By automating routine tasks, attorneys can focus on personalized strategies, complex family dynamics, and providing the human guidance that clients still deeply value.
Created By: Dalton Breshears
articles.title: How AI Is Changing the Estate Planning Attorneyâ€™s Role

articles.author: Adam Neves
articles.description:
Use your own machine to validate your MVP


When you're bootstrapping a project or simply want to validate an MVP without burning cash on infrastructure, most MVPs don't need a VPS. I just needed a URL I could share, fast. Thatâ€™s exactly what I did to get DevScout online and test the MVP.
In this article, Iâ€™ll explain how I used my own computer as a server, combined with Cloudflare Tunnel, to make the app publicly accessible, allowing me to test everything end-to-end, gather feedback, and only later invest in a proper VPS.
Simple: I didnâ€™t want to spend money before proving the idea had potential.
Even cheap VPS options can be overkill when you're still building and validating your minimum viable product. And for side projects or personal experiments, using your own machine with a tunnel câ€¦
articles.title: How I Validated My MVP Without Investing Any Cents On It Using Cloudflared Tunnel

articles.author: Kevin Ramirez
articles.description:
Yesterday, Apple dropped something unexpectedly beautiful at WWDC 2025. While we were all waiting for the next AI breakthrough, Tim Cook surprised everyone with iOS 26, featuring the new "Liquid Glass" design language. The design refresh is inspired by Apple's VR headset, the Vision Pro, bringing translucent menus, glossy icons and rounded controls across all Apple devices.
But here's the thing about us developers â€“ when Apple shows us something shiny and new, we can't help but think: "I bet I could build that with CSS." ğŸ¤“
So naturally, instead of waiting for iOS 26, I decided to recreate Apple's Liquid Glass effect using nothing but HTML and CSS. No JavaScript, no complex frameworks â€“ just good old-fashioned web magic.
Apple's Liquid Glass uses real-time rendering and dynamically reacts â€¦
articles.title: Recreating Apple's Liquid Glass Effect with Pure CSS âœ¨

articles.author: Stephen Akugbe
articles.description:
Hello, Iâ€™m excited to finally share what Iâ€™ve been working on: Postimy.
Postimy is your virtual assistant for all things social media. It helps you generate posts that actually sound like you, learning your tone, voice, and style over time. Whether you're trying to stay consistent on LinkedIn or Twitter, schedule posts across platforms, or brainstorm content ideas, Postimy is here to make it easier.
You can join the waitlist here if you want to try it early.
Postimy


Iâ€™ve always struggled with the consistency part of social media. I have ideas, I know what I want to say, but actually sitting down to write content every few days? That was always the problem.
Then it hit me! What if I could automate the content creation process but still make it feel authentic?
There are already tons of AI â€¦
articles.title: Introducing Postimy: Your Personal Content Assistant for Social Media
